message.content:
cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.RO 

The paper deals with the problem of designing control laws for stochastic jump linear systems, which is a topic in control theory (cs.SY). The authors use tools from statistical learning theory to estimate confidence regions for the unknown probability distributions, which suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves the estimation of probability distributions from a finite sample of i.i.d. observations, which is a common problem in statistics and data science (cs.DS). Finally, the authors use linear matrix inequalities (LMI) to cast the stability conditions as a tractable optimization problem, which is a technique commonly used in robotics and control theory (cs.RO).
